meanings.definition: A man given a rank of honor by a monarch or other leader for his bravery and service.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight protected the kingdom from danger.
meanings.sent2: The king bestowed the title of knight upon the loyal warrior.
meanings.sent3: The knight's armor was so shiny, he could see his reflection in it.
meanings.sent4: In the chess game of life, he was the knight, moving in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The knight's shield bore the emblem of his noble house.

meanings.definition: A person granted an honorary title for their achievements or contributions.
meanings.sent1: The talented musician was honored as a knight of music.
meanings.sent2: The community recognized her hard work and named her a knight.
meanings.sent3: Being called a knight made him feel like a hero in a storybook.
meanings.sent4: She was a knight of the kitchen, creating culinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The title of knight added a touch of grandeur to his name.

meanings.definition: To dub or create someone a knight in a formal ceremony.
meanings.sent1: The queen will knight the young squire for his bravery.
meanings.sent2: They plan to knight him at the upcoming royal ceremony.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the actor will knight the lead character with a plastic sword.
meanings.sent4: The mentor decided to knight his apprentice after years of training.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony to knight the new recruits was filled with tradition and pride.
